entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 4.21.25
entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Senator David Brock Smith talks about the crash that claimed the lives of an Umpqua Community College coach and a student-athlete on Friday night, the death of a fellow state senator over the weekend, Friday night’s Town Hall in Roseburg and other legislative toics

entry.title: TRANSIENT JAILED FOR MULTIPLE WARRANTS ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: April 21, 2025 11:00 a.m. A transient was jailed for multiple warrants by the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office on Saturday. A DCSO report said shortly after 12:30 p.m. a deputy contacted a 70-year-old man in the 600 block of Southeast Jackson Street in Roseburg, knowing he had the warrants. He was jailed on $13,750 bail.

entry.title: Dutch Bros Brews Up Retail Expansion with Consumer Packaged Goods Launch
entry.summary: Dutch Bros Inc. (NYSE: BROS), the rapidly expanding drive-thru coffee chain, has announced its entry into the consumer packaged goods (CPG) market. entry.title: Lithia & Driveway (LAD) Announces Chief Operating Officer Transition
entry.summary: MEDFORD, Ore., April 15, 2025 /PRNewswire/ — Lithia & Driveway (NYSE: LAD) has announced today that Adam Chamberlain will transition from his current role as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer effective June 1, 2025 to join Mercedes-Benz as CEO of Mercedes-Benz USA. “We are incredibly grateful for Adam’s leadership as our Chief Operating Officer and the value he brought to… The post Lithia & Driveway (LAD) Announces Chief Operating Officer Transition appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: New Study Illuminates Business Expansion Dynamics in Oregon
entry.summary: A recent study conducted by Business Oregon, in collaboration with Oregon Business & Industry and the University of Oregon, sheds light on the factors influencing business expansion decisions within the state. The research introduces a “push, pull, and anchor” framework to categorize elements that affect whether businesses choose to grow in Oregon or elsewhere.​ What… The post New Study Illuminates Business Expansion Dynamics in Oregon appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Oregon’s Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) Program Announces Entities that are Prequalified to Apply for Grants Starting April 22, 2025
entry.summary: Oregon will invest $689 million from federal BEAD funding to provide all unserved and underserved Oregonians with access to affordable, high-speed, reliable broadband. This milestone signals the beginning of the Scoring Phase, which will run from April 22 through May 22, 2025 for prequalified applicants. entry.title: Oregon’s Innovation Strategy Aims to Counter Workforce Crunch
entry.summary: Across the United States, a demographic shift is quietly reshaping the economy—and Oregon is no exception. With baby boomers retiring in record numbers, the state faces a dual challenge: a shrinking pool of experienced workers and growing demand for services, particularly in health care. This wave of retirements is leaving behind a talent gap that’s… The post Oregon’s Innovation Strategy Aims to Counter Workforce Crunch appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Spotlight: Oregon Trade and Tariff Impacts
entry.summary: Trade in Oregon Trade is a critical component to Oregon’s economy and the state’s businesses. By one measure, our economy’s reliance on trade is the sixth largest in the U.S., in terms of export value as portion of state GDP. Oregon also has the sixth highest rate of exports per capita in the U.S. Oregon’s leadership in trade is due to many… The post Spotlight: Oregon Trade and Tariff Impacts appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Oregon’s Multiple Jobholders in 2024
entry.summary: by Anna Johnson, Senior Economic Analyst, Oregon Employment Department April 8, 2025 In 2024, 127,000 Oregonians held more than one job in addition to their primary job and were considered multiple jobholders. entry.summary: by Brian Rooney, Regional Economist, Douglas and Lane counties, Oregon Employment Department April 18, 2025 Once Oregon’s largest manufacturing industry, employment in the wood product manufacturing industry has gone through large, well-publicized losses since the early 1990s. entry.title: Riddle Sawdust Jubilee at Risk: Community Support Urgently Needed to Keep Tradition Alive
entry.summary: The Riddle Sawdust Jubilee is at risk of cancellation due to low volunteer turnout and funding. Organizers urge the community to step up, donate, or volunteer to help save this cherished tradition. Let’s work together to keep the Jubilee alive for future generations.

entry.title: Roseburg’s 2025 Fourth of July Fireworks Show Officially Canceled
entry.summary: Due to lack of volunteer support, the Roseburg Hometown 4th of July Fireworks Committee has officially canceled the 2025 show. The organization is seeking dedicated individuals to take over leadership for future events.

entry.title: Tragedy on OR 42: UCC Softball Team Involved in Fatal Crash
entry.summary: Two people were killed and several members of the UCC softball team injured in a head-on crash on OR 42 in Coos County. A van carrying 10 players was struck by a pickup that crossed the centerline. Impaired driving is suspected. The crash is under investigation.
